intro: Antennaria reflexa, commonly known as the bent-leaved mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, hairy leaves that are often reflexed or curled backward, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically white or pink, appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems. Antennaria reflexa thrives in moist, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and coastal areas.
